questions.question_text: Which two entity properties can you disable on a system entity?

discussion.content: correct; rollup not possible for text and floating point numbers

questions.question_text: Which two field types can you configure as rollup fields? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

discussion.content: you can define action steps, so not sure if C or D is correct. The B however is correct.

questions.question_text:
You are implementing a new business process flow (BPF) in Microsoft Dynamics 365.
You specify a name and the primary intent for the BPF, and define the stages and conditions.
You need to configure the composition.
Which two options can you configure? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

choices.B: Set the Format to Date Only.
choices.A: Set the Behavior to User Local.
choices.C: Set the Behavior to Time-Zone Independent.
choices.D: Set the Behavior to Date Only.

questions.question_text:
You have a custom entity.
You need to add a date field that displays the date a user was hired. You must ensure that the value in the field remains the same, regardless of the time zone in which the field is viewed.
What are two possible ways to configure the field? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

discussion.content: C&D are the correct answers because it is the Behavior attribute, not the format, that effects time zone conversion. B- the format only effects that it displays only the date, but would still be subject to time zone conversion.
I feel this should be B & C

questions.question_text: Which two chart types can you combine with another chart type? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
